message_1: What is the final stable daughter nucleus produced as a result of the decay of Uranium-238 through multiple alpha and beta decays?
message_2: Uranium-238 (U-238) undergoes a series of alpha and beta decays to eventually form a stable daughter nucleus. The final stable daughter nucleus produced as a result of the decay of Uranium-238 is Lead-206 (Pb-206). The decay process involves 8 alpha decays and 6 beta decays.
